text: my name is hko geerman uh I'm a PhD and
I work at alumina at the Enterprise
informatics department where we create
software to analyze genomics data like
whole genome sequencing but also other
types of data so when I was in high
school I was thinking about what I
wanted to study and I was generally
attracted to science but I wasn't sure
what I liked most um and my father got
sick he got cancer and I really got
fascinated by how molecular biology and
manipulating DNA allowed you to
basically not only understand but even
treat diseases at Stanford um I got
really excited about the research that I
was doing there which was looking at the
DNA of healthy people extremely healthy
people so a lot of people obviously look
at sick people try to find the mechanism
of disease try to figure out what goes
wrong when you get cancer or heart
disease would be much better if we can
actually prevent disease and we're
actually doing that already with
cardiovascular disease we're giving
people who have nothing wrong with them
but a high cholesterol level drugs to
lower cholesterol so what really
motivated me and fascinated me was
taking that
Beyond cardiovascular into other areas
and try to figure out if there's
anything we can do to prevent disease
what can we find that's different about
healthy people versus sick people and
that's what really fascinates and
motivates me
